title: Man charged with murder, robbery in pair of weekend attacks
content:
A 26-year-old man was charged with killing a 17-year-old boy and wounding a 19-year-old man in the Back of the Yards neighborhood Saturday night, police said.
Deonte Davis was charged with first-degree murder, attempted first-degree murder and armed robbery with a firearm.
Police said he shot the two in the 5200 block of South Sangamon Street about 10:25 p.m. Saturday. He was driving a silver sedan when he stopped near the two and started shooting, police said.
The two were on a porch when Davis fired at them, according to Cook County court records. The man who survived was shot in the wrist, called 911 and gave officers a description of the car.
Police said Davis tried to rob a 53-year-old man in the 5100 block of South Halsted Street a few minutes before he's accused of shooting the two teens. The man was not injured in the attempted robbery. He was working as a security guard at a gas station when Davis pulled in, asked about the man's gang affiliations and then got out of the car to try to empty the guard's pockets, according to prosecutors.
The 53-year-old did not have anything in his pockets. The robbery attempt was captured on video, authorities said.
Officers in the area recognized the description of Davis' silver sedan from the robbery and the shooting and found the car three blocks from the shooting and six blocks from the murder about 40 minutes after the shooting.
The 17-year-old, identified by authorities as Christopher Fields, was shot in the back and pronounced dead at Stroger Hospital. He lived 10 blocks south of where he was shot.
Davis was standing near the car with three others when police found the car. The victim from the attempted robbery and the victim who survived the shooting both identified Davis, as did another witness to the shooting.
Davis was ordered held without bail and is due in court again on June 24.
